Reviews.Title: “Decent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: umyaya
Reviews.Content: Decent budget hotel. Very good service... friendly and helpful. Decent free breakfast (although not buffet so not as filling as others). Full English available though for modest charge. Bed was comfortable. Rooms clean. Carpets in rooms a bit worn and in need of repair but overall room was pleasant. Located on quiet square a couple blocks off street with tons of ethnic eateries. 10 minute walk to two tube stops and Kennsington Park. Stayed here for 7 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Budget as they come”
Reviews.Author: milanovictraveller
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel becasue it was cheap but in a nice area. The hotel was a little hard to find even with a taxi driver. I was warmly welcomed by the staff. My room as smallish and the bathroom was small as a cuboard but was decently clean. The furniture was a bit old looking and the window was hard to close and 1 of the staff had to come and give me a hand with it. The breakfast price was a bit pricey, I decided to get breakfast elsewhere for less. The staff are nice and have some good knowledge but most of them are forginers and most live in the hotel as well. No free wifi and have to buy a card to get access to the computer and wifi. floorboard were creaky so you could hear people walking around.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for departing tour”
Reviews.Author: Tracey H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Umi for one night prior to the departure of our tour as it was the departure/pick up point. We decided to stay at this hotel as it was convenient and seemed well priced in the area. The reception staff were friendly and were more than happy to offer suggestions to fill up our one day in London. However, the room was disappointing and let the rest of the hotel down. Our room was on a definite slant which was very off putting (feeling like you have had one too many drinks when you haven't), bathroom door kept opening due to the lean. It sounds like we got one of the bad rooms. Good proximity to train station and shops.

Reviews.Title: “everything is good”
Reviews.Author: Elena R
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel 2 times already and satisfied with everything. My rooms were clean and spacy enough (but I saw both bigger and smaller). You have all amenities in the room-TV, hair fan, tea pot. What I don't like is that the walls between the rooms and hall are thin so sometimes it is annoying, but I think that other hotels of this rate have the same. So I tryed not to stress on it. You can arrange continental or English breakfast in the morning. Or if you want - to go to cafe in 5 minutes walk. All stuff is freandly, hospitable and helpfull. Umi is located at close quarters to the many sights, parks, shops. So you don't need to waist time on the way to it. Nice hotel for good price.

Reviews.Title: “Not Superior”
Reviews.Author: Martin S
Reviews.Content: I booked a "superior" double room for valentines day night for me and my girlfriend. We got off the tube at Bayswater into a lovely area of London. The short walk was nice with the buildings exceptionally beautiful. We checked into the hotel and the staff were very friendly. However we were made to pay a Â£20 deposit on the room which there was no mention of on the website. After a very nervous trip in the elevator we got to the 3rd floor and into our room. I had decided to pay extra for a "superior" double compared to a regular double as we were there for one night and it was valentines day. However when we entered the small room we found a long list of problems: There were at least 5 holes in the walls One of the light switches was loose Uneven floor Single glazed windows which let in a draft and we couldn't shut properly The sink wasn't in our bathroom but in our bedroom The shower was dirty The carpets were stained The headboard was hung badly on the wall and not connected to the bed View out the back where there was some men were working on a roof There was a BIG gap in the door to the corridor, which combined with the window made a big draft which made the room very cold. If this was a superior I hate to imagine what a regular double was like. Needless to say I will not be staying here again and I'd urge other people to find a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Simon B
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the UMI London 5 - 9th Feb 2012. After reading some of the other reviews I was a little concerned (thieving staff, awful smell etc.) Personally I found the hotel reasonably comfortable & good value for money in an expensive city. Staff were always polite & courteous. I didn't use the restaurant, however it always seemed full at meal times. I had a single room on the first floor which was small but useable. If I have any complaint it is that the floors (throughout the first floor at least) were very uneven & anyone who is unsteady on their legs might find this a problem. They also creak alarmingly. If you happen to get an insomniac or somnambulist (sleep walker) next door the creaking of the floorboards as they move around would probably keep you awake! Also, the hotel would benefit from secondary glazing as the old single glazed windows are cold & slightly draughty. One final comment, I think the hotel is long overdue for a makeover. The carpets & furniture are looking decidedly tatty & in need of refurbishment. If you don't mind that & can settle for average rather than luxury then I would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value in a Pricey City”
Reviews.Author: samuel l
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in November 2011 and I was satisfied with my stay. Its hard to find a good, sensibly priced hotel in London. The decor was nothing to brag about and the buildings old age is very obvious. The amenities were all there though (bed, TV, private bathroom with shower, etc) and as a busy tourist using the room as a crash pad I found the accommodation to be comfortable. The staff was incredibly helpful and nice. I found that they had native english speakers working during the day and non native english speakers at night. There are two tube stops less than a 5 minute walk away too (Baywater and Queensway)! If you are not looking for a lavish pampering experience, this is not your hotel. But if you are a tourist looking for somewhere to recharge your batteries after a long day in one of the worlds most amazing cities, then this is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “A bathrobe is an exectutive suite!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ani B
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel over the phone, firstly being an english speaking country this hotel has minimul people who can speak english properly, I spoke to a Sarah she claims her name is!!! Who for one could not speak english properly and found it very hard to understand anthing that was said by her, i was on the phone for a minimum for 40 minutes trying to book a room before i left for my travels from austrailia. THIS WAS NOT A CHEAP PHONE CALL, the longest i have ever spoke to someone regarding booking a room. I booked an executive room for arounf Â£180.00 per night, as this was the "cheapest rate" they could offer me over christmas!!!!!!!! When i arrived at the hotel i thought it was a hostel!!! the pictures on the website are very misleading!!! The girls on reception were very scruffly dressed am sure most of 3* hotels have a dress code of smart office wear not jeans and shirts with caridgans not very proffessional, however i was checked in by a girl called selay who was very friendly and welcoming big change from the previous experince on the phone i had, it was a shame she could pay full attention as she had to help her collegue who was checking in another couple, as they could not understand what she was saying to them!!! After checking in i got in to the smallest and slowest lift to the 4th floor, i was expecting a very nice room being an executive room and paying the rates i was, THE ROOM WAS THE MOST ROOM DOWN ROOM old funiture with the sink the bedroom it was worse than a hostel...!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! The next morning i went down for breakfast after the worst night sleep ever, I was greeted very well and served by a very nice gentleman (indian i think looks around 30s) I was given my full english breakfast wich i enjoyed the gentleman spoke to me asking about our stay etc, and he knew i was not happy, and told me he would try his hardest to make it better and offered if i wanted to change room, he made the transition for my room move without any fuss which was brilliant and would like to thank his for all the help during my stay!!! The second room i went too was alot better but the creakly floor boards still didnt help me or my partner sleep . The only good thing about this hotel is the location as it is close to everything and easy to get back to. I would never stay here again, not at that price there are alot nicer hotels in the area TRY AND BOOK ANOTHER HOTEL IN THE AREA!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best to find somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: MML651
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good area and in easy walking distance to Bayswater station. The really small room was simply awful - down a flight of (dirty) carpeted stairs, broken window, handbasin awkwardly placed in room, written instructions not to leave food unsealed! Dreadful smell (dead rat?) in passage and lift area. Staff were helpful but not friendly and access to the internet is expensive. Avoid laundry down the road or make sure they rinse clothes well! Found Pret a Manger in the main street for breakfast - free wifi, wonderful hot porridge and honey: see [--]

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Good price”
Reviews.Author: europe21
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I wanted a cheap place to stay in London for 5 nights and Umi was great. Easy check in and the receptionist gave us a map of all the POI around the hotel and where the restaurants were located. The rooms are basic but clean and big enough to not trip over our two large suitcases. The location is great with three tube stations within five minutes walk and lots of cheap restaurants and shops just down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great views”
Reviews.Author: M0nkey80
Reviews.Content: I travelled to London for my sisters wedding and needed somewhere cheap nearby and stumbled across umi. I advised when booking that I would need to change my booking more than once due to flight date uncertainty and also other logistics. The reservations manager advised that this is absolutely fine. I ended up changing my dates 3 times. I apologised in my last email. I was then sent an abrupt email back advising that they could not help for any further changes and that I would need to cancel my booking and rebook at whatever rate is available!! This was certainly a different tone to my first contact with them. I had also given more than two weeks notice!! So, despite this, I stayed and was surprised that the staff were actually lovely and the hotel is in such a great location! I would definitely stay again and recommend to others. Just avoid any reservations 'customer service'.

Reviews.Title: “Central to everything”
Reviews.Author: LiosaR
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful 2 night stay. The hotel is close to everything, near Bayswater station and has lots of shops and food shops along the way. The hotel's breakfast is also good. I liked the idea of toast for breakfast (where i stayed previously it was pastry for breakfast!) The staff were great, the room clean, tidy and great. Bathroom was a bit small but thats ok. Overall it was my break away from everything. The bed was also nice and soft.

Reviews.Title: “All Location and not much else”
Reviews.Author: Squirreltail
Reviews.Content: We paid Â£60 for somewhere to stay on a week night. The location is brilliant, a short walk form Portobello and the reception were very helpful at 12am. The hotel and hotel rooms though have seen much better days. It is a great cheap place if you just need to ut your head down for the night but do not come expecting too much.

Reviews.Title: “Good but......”
Reviews.Author: Ashleigh82
Reviews.Content: We paid Â£70 per night for our room which for London we were rather pleased with.... On arrival we were extremely pleased with the location, only a 5 minute walk from Bayswater Tube Station which is on the circle line so really we were in the hub of activity so in a nut shell the location was faultless. The hotel reception was pleasent, well maintained and had a super coffee bar and dining area. It offered a selection of free newspapers and magazines and a wealth of info on London such as maps and guides. Check in was painless however there was an issue with holding money on our credit card for the room which on departure would be released, however this takes 3 days to clear with the bank so was a bit of nightmare. We had reada previous review by someone else saying this so we made sure we budgeted for this. Our room..... On a positive the room was clean, the bed was comfortable and there was tea/coffee making facilities and lovely buscuits which were replentished daily. On a negitive the bathroom, whilst clean, was of a poor standard. The shower screen was siliconed to the bath so it wouldn't move making it difficult to get in and out, I almost slipped twice andade reception aware of this. The carpet throughout, again whilst clean, could do with being replaced but this is only cosmetic and wouldn't prevent me from staying again. I would definately stay in this hotel again and would recommend it but only of you are open minded and aren't expecting The Ritz but want a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy”
Reviews.Author: tippiella
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a superior double for five nights this November. The room was a good size, a bit shabby and worn down, but acceptable. No sink in the bathroom, this was kept in the room beneath the TV, which seemed a bit strange. The bed was comfortable, but the floor (and consequently the bed) was slanting so much that I had trouble not rolling off it throughout the night. The floors were also extremely creaky and the walls thin, and as our upstairs neighbors seemed to be a group of young students on a school trip who were not particularly loud but liked staying up until 3 a.m. talking and moving about a lot, this was a rather unlucky combination. I could also mention that there was a problem with our booking when we arrived, the internet company that we had ordered through had only forwarded two of the three room reservations we had booked to the hotel. While I realize that this was not the hotel's fault, and did not blame them in any way for the mix-up, I do wish the staff had been more helpful and welcoming. The young woman that we encountered at the front desk was rather arrogant and rude, but reluctantly let us use the internet without charge to double check our reservation and get the number for the booking company to get the problem sorted. Could have done without her snide remarks, but her colleagues all seemed nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, a bit shabby”
Reviews.Author: chissis
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Umi on the backside of a trip to London, then Plymouth, then back to London. I chose this hotel because it was available with AA miles. The Bayswater location was excellent, in a great area surrounded by wonderful restaurants. Very comfortable walking about at night; and so close to the Tube and bus lines. The room I had (#108) was very noisy though, because it was above the office. I heard doors banging all night every night for four nights. The room was very dated, the furniture very shabby, but the bed was clean, the bathroom okay, and the price was right. I love the area and would probably stay at this hotel again, knowing that it is well located, but I would request a different room for sure.

Reviews.Title: “loud with incompetent staff”
Reviews.Author: Hello128
Reviews.Content: We left a lot of money in this hotel to get basically a really loud room where you can hear anyone passing by on the floor, a cleaning lady that storms at you in the morning without knocking, and receptionists who doesn`t tell you that you pay twice* *they block the total sum on your account at your check-in that won`t be available for 2 weeks after your check-out. So when you leave you actually pay again from the part of your account that is actually still not blocked. The area is wonderful but I`d choose another hostel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: hwfang
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at this hotel. The decor at the visitors' lounge, dining and reception area were a lot better than I had expected. The staff were friendly and cheerful. Our room was clean and had a lovely view. However, my sleep was disturbed during the night as a result of creaking floor board from the surrounding rooms and the floor above. Movements by guests in the surrounding rooms caused the floor to produce disturbing creaking sound. If not for this, I would say we had a lovely stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good.”
Reviews.Author: 1879fulham
Reviews.Content: For an economy hotel, this place is very good. Stayed at the hotel last night. The hotel was busy. I had booked a single room but was given a double room which was very clean, comfortable and had pretty much all you could possibly need. The staff are friendly as well. This hotel is very popular with the tourist brigade who are on a budget. The only little nag from me is that they charge for wi-fi (Â£7 for 24 hours). Not massive but still annoying.

Reviews.Title: “very pleased”
Reviews.Author: Bosko A
Reviews.Content: This is a great value hotel in a quiet area of Bayswater and only 5 minutes from Bayswater tube station making the rest of London easily accessible. The room we stayed in was comfortable, quiet and meticulously clean. Booking in was quick and painless. All the staff I encountered were friendly, polite and only too willing to help with advice and assistance. All in all the place had a nice relaxed ambience about it . Given the price we paid the Umi surpassed our expectations and we will definitely be staying there again the next time we visit London.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay with great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth R
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the UMI London hotel this October. Me and my husband had travelled to London to visit our daughter. Whilst he went to pick her up I decided to go to the hotel to check in. I'd arrived around 1:00pm but was too early as check in time was at 2pm. I was greeted by two very welcoming receptionist. One of them named Selay was very helpful during the whole stay. She made sure I could check in at 1pm by moving things around as I looked completely tired out and needed a lie down. After checking in I wasn't very happy with the room as it was too small for my liking. So she also managed to move me to another room even though it was completely busy at reception. It was definitely a very pleasant stay after that. I'd recommend anyone to stay here considering how friendly the staff is. The two receptionist Selay and the trainee girl at reception that day definitely made it worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “STEALING STAFF/ NEVER STAY”
Reviews.Author: Jessica W
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Umi Hotel August 2011 for one week before a tour and one night post a tour. Firstly half the receotion staff were very friendly but the other half had no work ethic, were rude and would continue talking about their weekend without serving customers. I travel regularly and always look my suitcases whereve possible when I am not in the room. I had washed a black cardigan that morning and left it hanging over the back of a chair to dry, I was out of the room from 0700-2000hrs. When I arrived back my room had been cleaned and given fresh towels but my cardigan was missing. I went down to the hotel reception and they assured me apart from the cleaners noone else would have entered the room and they would check with the cleaners the next day. I followed this up and the answers were "noone told us to forward on this message and the cleaners have gone" (different reception staff) so I waited another 2 days until I received a reply stating they had no seen it it had not been accidently taken with the towels and that "IT MUST BE IN MY TRUNK" no it is not in my trunk i have looked multiple times, this issue was never resolved. My main issue (and I should have learnt from the cardigan incident) but some of my friends were keeping some of their valuables in the hotel managers safe whilst travelling to different places to decrease risk of pickpockets. I decided to leave my iphone in the safe. I had written confirmation and verbal by the staff that it would be safe and that only the manager and some reception staff had access to this safe. I confirmed multiple times about the date and time (even the day before) and was assured it was fine to pick up then. When I got there I was informed my phone had been MISPLACED. After meetings with the managers and head of Umi hotels they gave me so many excuses that it was accidently sent in the mail, there was NO LOG of this to prove and why would it have been if it was locked up safely. I had to catch my return flight to australia and was assured this matter wouldnt be forgotten just because I was out of the country. Once in Australia I was ignored completely. No replies from emails and when I tried to call the reception staff always seemed to say the managers werent in today and would leave a message. I didnt get ONE call back! My emails were only replied to (about 3 times in the total of 40 days) when I threatened to involve the police in the issue. All i wanted was one incident report from them stating what happened so I could put in an insurance claim back in Australia but they wouldnt take 5 minutes out ot their time to write it whilst I spent hours trying to organise a phone and did not have a proper phone (and still dont). I never once asked for reimbursment for my insurance excess or my time just a report and they wouldnt even do that. It proves they really do not care about customers and have no customer service. I have never complained about a hotel and the rooms were fine and so were the facilities in line with a 2 star hotel but I need to put warnings out to other travellers do not stay here!!!! And if you do please lock all your valuables up and keep everything on you at all times! I did not expect this from London and did not expect or deserve the rudeness and arrogance of the staff in this matter. They wouldnt even return the calls from my insurance company!! There are so many hotels around this beautiful area so there is absolutely no need to have to stay here!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location but beware of the dodgy man....”
Reviews.Author: kiwideni
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is great, about 5 minutes walk to Bayswater train station and the shops, cafes, fast food chains, and a mall. We arrived a bit early so we were asked to leave our luggage in the storage room which was packed so full you could barely get the door open...Check in went smoothly, the receptionists are really helpful and friendly. Our room was great, tidy and very nicely decorated. Our bathroom was upstairs though which was a bit weird and the water pressure in the shower wasn't great but other than that our room was good, bed's were comfortable and the snacks/water bottles were handy too. We enjoyed our stay here and would definitely return again! BEWARE of the strange black man who roams the streets of Bayswater looking for tourists to scam. We were less than 1 block away from the Umi Hotel when he overheard me talking to my partner, he came over with another couple in tow and offered to show us where to go which after we said it was ok we didn't need help he said "Don't worry it's my job" we didn't bother replying we just kept walking. After we rounded the corner to get to the hotel, we started walking off to the hotel and he followed us and started talking about how close the train station was and the facilities close by- we thought he was just being friendly and then he asked us to PAY him for his service... I gave him about 1 pound change to which he asked for more, then he turned to my partner and asked him for more money! We quickly told him we didn't have money and just started walking away... It's a shame that this guy hangs round, it wasn't really a good first impression of the area we were in....

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here again when in London”
Reviews.Author: ozgal11
Reviews.Content: I found the staff very friendly and helpful and the rooms exactly what I expected. It was a nice surprise when I got back from my travels elsewhere to find that I was in a double room. Very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Location great, Hotel OK, Service Ordinary”
Reviews.Author: trinks-au
Reviews.Content: Looking for somewhere cheap in London for your family? This could be it. Very easy to get around from here - Tube, Bus, Feet, Bike. Plenty of options. Same with restaurants nearby - French, Indian, Mexican & more all within 5-10 minute walk. Pub 2 minutes, laundry 2 minutes. Small supermarket 5 minutes. Larger shopping center (Queensway about 10 minute walk). The rooms were clean & comfortable enough. Shower worked well. It's just old & in need of upgrading. However - you get what you pay for. The service was very average, friendly enough when you could get their attention, I didn't feel they were very helpful, they could try a bit harder. Felt pretty safe in the neighbourhood. Plenty of posh places nearby, even saw a major celb at the grocery store. Not sure if I'd stay here again. Probably bite the bullet & spend a bit more somewhere else. Internet charges were over the top for a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Visiting London for the first time”
Reviews.Author: humbleboy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was booked by my brother whom I was visiting with my mum to attend his graduation in Nottingham before arriving in London. Our phone GPS says its approximately 5-6 minutes walk from Bayswater tube and yes it was around that. Exterior of the hotel looks brilliant and as I enter the Reception, the check-in process was alright but since we were early, we had to come back at around 2pm. We walked to a nearby restaurant for lunch and we timed properly to return to the hotel by 2pm as promised. Upon returning, we were told our rooms weren't "ready". The staff mistaken us for the Asian family that came about 5 minutes before and assumed we were together with them. After exchanging a few sentences, they found out we were another family. We were checked in at around 2:23pm and when we had taken the keys to our room, I was shocked to not only find out our room was extremely small for 3 people but this place looks a bit run down and shabby. It has seen its days my mum thought. The pictures online were not helpful but deceiving. Mum caught TWO cockroaches in the room and we once were greeted with one cockroach as we were leaving our room to go out. When we take our shower, we could hardly stretch our hands or move about. Shampoo and body wash weren't replenished as we thought they will. We stayed for four nights and only used their shampoo & body wash on first day and last night of our trip. Thank goodness we had our own amenities along. Price wise, it could been better for around Â£130 per night. Quite pricey for this type of a hotel in London. Key cards was "cut" for the wrong room. Our room was on the 3rd floor but was cut for the 2nd floor. How careless I thought. The lift wasn't doing any better. Going up and down was already time consuming, stuffy, small and hardly could move if you have lots of luggages. Breakfast was just alright. Couldn't expect any better breakfast as everyone there were having the same. We have to pay extra if we wish to have hot food.

Reviews.Title: “If you like to share your bedroom with mice, go ahead”
Reviews.Author: Thais_11
Reviews.Content: I've been at Umi for one night only, for my master's graduation ceremony. It was an OK hotel, I booked a single room and it was bigger than average. The day manager was really nice and took care of my luggage before I could get into my bedroom. At night I went to my room and I saw the mouse near my bed. I ran to the reception and the night manager was terrible (to say the least). He said he didn't understand why I was upset and at some point he even laughed. What a service, uh?! He gave me another room that was with the windows open because of the strong smell of paint in the walls. I didn't discuss anymore and I left the hotel. It took me one hour at 4am in the morning to find another hotel to sleep. In the next day I went back and they told me they new about my situation and gave me 40% discount!! Of course I didn't accept and when I told then about the unkind manager they finally appologize for the situation and gave me the refund. There are thounsands of hostels in London, so you don't need to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, nice location, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_traveller053
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June. The hotel was in a good location and breakfasts were good and staff were friendly. I think it is good value for the location. BUT if you can avoid staying in the very top floor where we were, I would. It seemed to be where they put the backpackers or groups and so it was noisy and you also have to cart your case up a flight of stairs. We had an extra bunk in our room (which we did not use) and it made the room extremely small. Our friends stayed on level one and paid a little extra for coffee bags and a deluxe room which I think is worth it if you can afford it. Their room was a lot nicer than ours on the top floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: chrisp781
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife earlier this year when we were visiting family, facilities were of a high standard and our room very clean. There was a bit of noise, but it is London afterall! Staff were all friendly and well informed. Would stay their again.

Reviews.Title: “If you only need a place to sleep, this is it.”
Reviews.Author: jqli
Reviews.Content: We are a couple in their 30's and stayed in Umi in June for a few nights during our visit to London. This hotel is not bad if you are on a budget and only need a bed to sleep. The hotel is close to a good selection of restaurants with metro station in 5 minutes' walking distance. The reception is quite helpful. However, we found it noisy as we can hear ppl walking both upstairs and in the corridor. The room is quite small with a tiny bathroom smelling of fresh paint. The room is quite old with stained carpets. Free WI FI is not available. The worst to me is their breakfast with very limited choices and quality is very average. In summary, this is a budgeted hotel so donot expect a luxury service. However, we may opt for a better quality hotel at a reasonably higher price.

Reviews.Title: “Room ok but very loud.”
Reviews.Author: BRibeiro
Reviews.Content: We arrived too early to check in so they said we could store our luggage in the luggage room. When we unlocked the door we could barley open it because it was so jam packed full of luggage. The staff was very nice about letting us keep our luggage behind the desk. once we checked in the room was clean. the bathroom was small. We had an issue with our toilet not flushing and called the front desk about it to which they replied we'll send some one right up to look at it. Needless to say we feel asleep waiting for some one and no one ever showed. The rooms are by no mean sound proofed. We were right by the elevators and could hear every time the elevator would move. There must have been some school group staying on the same floor because we could hear a bunch of teenagers running up and down the halls laughing at 10pm

Reviews.Title: “Great find in London!”
Reviews.Author: kgllgk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Umi for 4 nights in June. Customer service is excellent at this hotel. We were concerned reading some of the negative reviews, but we were more than satisfied with our stay at The Umi. The rooms are older, but everything was very clean. The complimentary breakfast was excellent as well as the service in the restaurant. Our only minor gripe would be that the floors were creaky above our room, and we cold hear the people in the room above us walking around every morning at 5am. Location was great, near 2 tube stations, and an easy walk to a busy street with lots of shops and restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Beware Saturday Night”
Reviews.Author: Aussie9764
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Umi London last week. Room was clean maintained, no air con. Saturday night we reported LOUD+++++++ people at 2 .00 am this noise continued until 5.00 am. Next day reception stated that there was a private function every Saturday night. I would stay during the week, but NEVER on a Saturday night. Breakfast was included, which was good. Good location handy to train stations.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: BRA_BNE
Reviews.Content: I really don' get the bad reviews on this one here. It should be an easy assumption that if you look for a cheap place to stay you won't get the looks or the service of a 4/5 star hotel. The location is great, very close to Notting Hill, in between two underground station, so moving around the city was really easy. The bed was comfortable and the continental breakfast was really simple but good and the ladies looking after the breakfast room were always friendly to us. On the down side, the rooms really need some renovation but it's London, you really only need a place to sleep and shower as the city has so many things for you to explore. All in all, it's really good value for London and I'd definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Wisteria51
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel was the staff who were all very friendly and helpful. The concierge was able to get us theatre tickets at short notice and service in the cafe was fast and efficient. The hotel itself is quite old and the room quality is variable. I have stayed in a few different rooms here and some were better than others. The linen and bathroom were clean but in some rooms the carpet is old and dirty. The location is very good being near several underground stations and a easy walk to Kensington Gardens. The hotel is situated in a quiet street but is close to a main road with lots of restaurants etc. I think the Umi is good value for money but I thought the charges for internet access were a bit too much.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SofiePetters
Reviews.Content: + The staff was very friendly and helpful. + nice area (quiet), metro not far away (with good connections) - My room was very hot!! - Rooms are a bit outdated, could use a renovation

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, safe, good value place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lynnehepburn
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a pretty well to do area and is very quiet away from traffic. Entrance/reception areas modern and clean with lots of information leaflets and newspapers. Comfy sofas and internet area too which kept my teenage son occupied. There is a lift to the upper floors however wheelchair users would need ramps to be assembled at the entrance to the building to get in. Doors on the bedroom floors narrow for a wheelchair user. The staff were very friendly and went out of their way to help with requests so we felt very welcome. Everything was explained to us in detail. There is a bar/restaurant in the basement. We went to the restaurant and ordered 4 different meals. The restaurant was empty but we waited a long time for the food which was acceptable but nothing to rave about. The portions were big though. The bar area was also quiet but it would be a lovely place just to chill and watch tv or read. The royal wedding was our main reason for visiting London and we had booked a family room for 2 nights. It was a large room with 4 single beds and a large bathroom. The beds were VERY CLEAN which suited our family of clean freaks. Our towels were also very clean. Beds and towels were changed each day. A flat screen tv and coffee/tea facilities were provided also a hairdryer/safe (extra charge for safe). The bathroom was large, very clean, soap/bodywash provided/tissues provided. The bathroom did need refurbished. We had a continental breakfast each morning. We had cards where we could choose 4 items. We could choose from different cereals, yoghurt, juices, tea, coffee, toast croissants. Very nice and very pleasant in the breakfast area and watching tv whilst eating was good too. Our room was at the end of the corridor on the 3rd floor and faced onto Leinster Square. The view was of the gardens of the opposite houses and very pleasant. We did hear the guests moving about in the room above. Overall a great place to stay, I would go back no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: ENels2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Umi for seven nights in mid April. When traveling in Europe, we try to book budget hotels that are clean and located in good areas. The Umi fit the bill perfectly. We switched rooms part way through the trip due because we spent a night in Belgium. The first room was small, the second much larger. Both were older, but clean with comfortable beds and flat screen TVs. Perfectly adequate for our needs. The real pros of this hotel are (1) location - in Bayswater, right next to Notting Hill, and very close to Kensignton Gardens. Close to multiple tube stops and very pretty, peaceful part of the city. (2) The continental breakfast was excellent and included in our price. (3) The staff was very friendly. As one example, one of the breakfast room staff members memorized our coffee preferences (which are picky) and prepared them for us on arrival to the breakfast room every morning. In summary, we highly recommend this hotel for those looking for a clean, value hotel in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “does what it says on the tin!”
Reviews.Author: littleteaspoon
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay here, I stayed 3 nights as a solo traveller so I booked a room with a single bed. I stay at 4 & 5 star hotels for work but have stayed at many budget places in London when on personal trips, so I think I have a pretty wide range of experience. For the price i paid (GBP50 a night) and the excellent location I expected it to be tiny and probably pretty run down, more like a hostel than a hotel.. I was pleasantly surprised. The room was large with a wardrobe, big desk, plenty of moving around space, and a large window facing the square. The bathroom was tiny but serviceable - I'm quite short though and I think if I'd been taller I'd have had to put my feet in the shower when using the toilet! The basin was in the room rather than the bathroom. Everything was very clean, and not run down at all. Old, but well kept. There's no fridge or minibar, but tea/coffee and soaps in the room. The rooms are serviced every day, I can't comment on this though as I had my do not disturb sign up. The staff were always helpful and friendly, you could tell they enjoy their jobs. When I wanted ice and the bar was closed a staff member unlocked it for me and brought the ice up to my room, and then when their kitchen was closed the guy at reception called a local place for me to see if they were still serving. it's little things like that that show the difference! I've had much worse customer service in 4 star hotels. there were only 2 cons I could find - the room was really hot, the building must not be insulated very well. As an australian it wasn't an issue for me, but others might have been bothered! However when I asked for a fan I was brought one immediately :-) The other thing was that it was quite noisy during the day, as my room was near the stairs (there is a lift but it only goes up to the 4th floor, so anyone on 5th had to drag their suitcases up) again it didn't bother me that much, but I would suggest that if you plan to sleep in, ask for a room away from the staircase. All in all an excellent place for the money and location. Go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Ugh.”
Reviews.Author: bryanlljones
Reviews.Content: Booked this place on hotels.com & it seemed like a bargain for a 3.5 star hotel. I ended up in a dank basement suite. There was water damage on the carpets, the paint was old & peeling in every room & the furniture is mismatched & looks like it was sourced at a garage sale. It was cheap but definitely overrated. The rooms in the main hotel might be better (they were fully booked). Ugh.

Reviews.Title: “customer service and hospitality was top !”
Reviews.Author: m7yvr
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 3 nights to do a bit of sightseeing in London. The location of the hotel was superb. When I arrived at the hotel I was greeted by very friendly and helpful staff at reception. Unfortunately there was a problem with the warm water in my room and had to be removed. However the receptionist on duty Monica Bhika was very helpful in gettin my room changed with ease. As soon as the problem was fixed I was moved back into my original room because I liked it better and she personally took care of this for me without any headchace. It was a pleasure to be greeted by Monica every morning with a strong smile and small conversation making every guest feel very welcome. Overall I would definately stay at this hotel again as the location and staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Doremi_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Umi Hotel because it was the departure and return point for our European tour. Having read the mixed reviews on trip advisor we were unsure what to expect. However on arrival we were very pleasantly surprised by our accommodation - our room was a decent size and appeared to have been recently refurbished with new wallpaper, furniture and a modern bathroom. Daily continental breakfast was included in our package (served in the restaurant) and was more than adequate. We were allocated a different room when we returned at the end of our tour, and although this room was considerably older, it was nevertheless in good condition. We did not experience any problems with noise, although this may have been because for both of our visits we were located in the far corner of the building. Staff were friendly and helpful, and we enjoyed our stay at the Umi Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for a little price!”
Reviews.Author: Lollipop495
Reviews.Content: When we booked a two days stay at the UMI, we expected some kind of hostel style hotel. We were wrong. This "Notting Hill style home" is a perfectly fine hotel in a great location. You are not afraid to walk outside at night, it is located in a very lovely neighborood and the included breakfast was tasty. The staff were very helpful to our requested and are always avalable to assist you. I definitly recommend this hotel, however, due to its low price, you will find many young poeple / school type group staying there. No worries, the walls are thick!

Reviews.Title: “Front of house - fantastic”
Reviews.Author: babyg240
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be good value for money. The staff ensured my stay was enjoyable. Front of House staff were welcoming on arrival and smartly dressed. One staff member in particular (Chrissy) went above and beyond to meet my party's various requests from the initial booking and throughout my stay. Ensuring my party's needs were catered for and also provided good local information, including shows and places to eat. The rooms are reflective of price and could do with re-modernising, however I found them to be clean and comfortable. The only issue I had, was that there were loud noises early in the morning and despite our checkout time of 11am, housekeeping knocked our door at around 8:30am. Other than this, not a sound heard all night, despite the karaoke taking place in the bar downstairs. A good variety of choice for breakfast, although some communication barriers did effect the speed of service. All in all, a very pleasant stay, hoping to book again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but clumsy staff”
Reviews.Author: LellaSS
Reviews.Content: I visited London with a bunch of university students last week and stayed at Umi. I found this hotel in the last minute deals as the one i had reserved had been cancelled. The rates were not bad since the hotel was advertised as a 3 star hotel. So we paid Â£279,97 for a double room, breakfast not included. And the web site said this rate was 40% off the origianal price. We were happy for the amazing central location in Bayswtaer/Queensway,but as we checked in, we realised the staff (almost non English natives), were a little clumsy in dealing with the reservation. First they said they had already charged the whole amount on my credit card, later, when we explained we wanted to pay cash, they looked surprised and took them a long time to fix everything. They didn't even issue a receipt after the payment. Same long issues when i asked to pay for my breakfst by debit card.. Anyways, the rooms were really spacious for the UK standards, the bathroom had a shower and the toilet, The basin, very tiny, was in the bedroom. The toiletries provided enough and we appreciated the bathrobe. Complimentary biscuits and water as well as tea and coffee making facilities were provided daily.We experienced some inconvenience on our departure day since one of the students couldn't find her id card and boarding card and she claimed sha had left them in her room during the whole stay. We reported it to the manager, but they were not helpful. We supposed the chamber maids had thrown it away without realising it. We would have expected more support, sympathy and concern, which we didn't get. So we had to stay 2 days longer in London to have a new ID issued from the Italian Consulate for the student who was not allowed on the Ryanair flight back without an authentic id.. obviously we changed hotel for the next2 days.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints!”
Reviews.Author: Sizzle02
Reviews.Content: Having read a number of reviews about this hotel I was slightly worried about how good the hotel would turn out to be, but I was pleasantly surprised! I had booked a single room but got a twin. The staff were friendly, the room was clean and tidy and very quiet. The breakfast was also lovely with a lot to choose from. I have no complaints whatsoever about my stay and would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel in great location to walk to Hyde park”
Reviews.Author: RealAlefan_11
Reviews.Content: Relaxed environment with friendly staff and good cafe and bar. Great value and excellent location near main line station and within short walk to Hyde Park and main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and staff”
Reviews.Author: wolfi33
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel for visting London the service was great from start to finish. Jimmy from the bar was great, breakfast was very good and quick service I have stayed at alot hotels and this breakfast was one of the best. The staff are very helpful. The only bad comment I have is the bedroom they need to be refurbished to make this hotel even better. Thank you for a great stay, I will be coming back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I would rather have stayed at the hostel from Quentin Tarininto's movie.”
Reviews.Author: rgreend
Reviews.Content: Most of the people who work at this hotel are incredibly rude and unprofessional. Expect to be woken up by yelling maids at 6 AM or the weekly fire alarm. The beds move a lot and the floors creak to the point that you will be surprised not to have fallen through the ceiling. I would also like to add that the hotel staff called an unmarked taxi for me and my friends. Despite some nice workers, I found a lot to be incredibly rude. In addition to this, maids will attempt to wake you up during your naps and try to convince you to get out of bed so they can clean. It is not until the 5th "Please come back later" that they will leave. Also, the toilets do not flush.

Reviews.Title: “Umi London: Worst Hotel in the Entire City”
Reviews.Author: jkeyes2
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler and I can promise you, this is the absolute worst hotel I have ever stayed in in my entire life. If I could have switched hotels, I absolutely would have, but the University I am traveling with booked the hotel so I had no choice. Some of the staff was very nice, but the staff members who were not nice were probably the RUDEST people I have ever met. They have employees living there, which wouldn't be a big deal if they understood to be professional even when they weren't on duty, but they did not stay professional when they clocked out. There was an employee who lived across the hall from my room who was so noisy, blasting music into all hours of the night and I had to go knock on her door to ask her to be quiet because I had to get up the next morning for class and she gave me a rude look, said okay and closed the door on my face. You would think that because she lived there, she would know how thin the walls are. Also, the floors are extremely creaky, so if you want to get any sleep at night, request the 5th floor, but just know that there is no elevator to the 5th floor, you have to take the elevator to the 4th floor and then go to the steps and walk up a flight of stairs. The free breakfast in the morning is delicious, but don't expect them to get your order correct.. they got my order right 3 times out of the 2 and a half weeks I was there. Don't waste your money on the internet options they claim works, because it only works from early morning until about 5pm, and then you can't log on because the server is always "down." They took our soap one day and we had to ask for it back numerous times and we didn't get it back until 2 days later?? I'm not sure what was up with that. They opened our window in our room when it had been pouring all day, nonstop, (like it does most of the time, so they shouldn't have opened it at all) and the bed by the window got soaked and the front desk didn't care at all. I just feel bad for the people running the hotel because they obviously don't know how to run a hotel. DO NOT STAY HERE. There are PLENTY of other options in London that are much better. And I don't complain ever, so you know this is for real.

Reviews.Title: “Um'impressed, felt more like a hostel than a hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelclicktv
Reviews.Content: If I was a Gap year student travelling round the UK this might appeal with it's Notting Hill address, but our Superior Double, should have been called an Inferior Double at best. As I went to the bathroom, I realised that something vital was missing, the toilet was there, the shower, but the sink? Where was the sink? Ah yes it was in the room just under the television, set in a cabinet with a lovely stain on the side. This hotel exuded an air of grubbiness, and you knew that many people had passed through this room. I certainly cannot accuse them of having bed bugs, but you felt that if a bed bug had ideas on somewhere to sleep for the night, it would certainly pick UMI!

Reviews.Title: “Redeemed themselves”
Reviews.Author: Lancashirelass80
Reviews.Content: Following a stay there in May 2009 I wrote to complain about them trying to move rooms when they had assured us we would be in the same room for all of our stay. They replied and offered a free nights stay. Although this was 18 months later they honoured this promise and our stay was great. The beds are comfortable, rooms clean and contain all you need including an iron and hairdryer and a comfortable walk to the tube and even shorter one to the bus stops. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience, confused and unprofessional staff”
Reviews.Author: wdonson
Reviews.Content: One of the worst hotel experiences I've had this year, when we showed up at Umi they couldn't even located our booking. They charged the wrong room rate, had some creepy guy trying to carry our luggage to the room (which we eventually got after 35 minutes of waiting and endless argument). The rooms are tiny and the bathroom below what would be expected from a three star place. Avoid like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “A nice, clean hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Cecilie_HT
Reviews.Content: My parents, my younger brother and I have just come home from a 2 day stay in London. We come from Denmark, and sailed to England by ferry. The stay at Umi Hotel was included in our ferry ticket, and we didn't have incredibly high expectations. We would be satisfied if the hotel was clean and close to the tube. We were pleasently surprised. The hotel is located very close to Bayswater Station, but still in a quiet area, where you can get a good night's sleep. The rooms were in a good size with a flatscreen TV, good beds and bathrooms with showers. The rooms were very clean too. There's a restaurant at Umi, which serves both breakfast and dinner. We had breakfast there. There were a lot of options on the menu, which was nice. The english was well cooked and overall it was a good eating experience. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and helped us the the timetables for the busses etc. Overall we had a very nice stay and would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely staff, nice Cafe but rooms need a bit more love and attention - great for the money though”
Reviews.Author: yellowpig
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with kids aged 7 & 10 to be near Hyde Park, Notting Hill & shops - fantastic location but area in places feels a bit run down. Hotel great value for money - nice Cafe / restaruant, staff very helpful - rooms very basic but clean. Its a very old building thats been done up as best as possible but the bathrooms need a bit more cash spending on them.

Reviews.Title: “It was Amazing i give it a 5 star!!!”
Reviews.Author: Eloise1237
Reviews.Content: It was a very tidy and very relaxing. In the rooms they lay out tea with biscuits and a kettle! We payed Â£40 and it was worth the money!!! The food there is very nice eg. the breakfast. You get alot of channels on the television like CBBC Entertainment and much more.There very kind at the desk and help you with your luggage so therefore i recommend this hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and basic”
Reviews.Author: Kask_8
Reviews.Content: We booked a twin room which wasn't huge but quite adequate. the bathroom could have used a bit of a facelift, but everything was kept very clean. You could hear people in room above a bit, but so brief it didn't really bother us. Beds comfortable and room quite relaxing. Food a bit on the pricey side, but of excellent quality at both the cafe and restaurant (though I wouldn't bother with the continental - i don't think you get your money's worth). The waiting staff were excellent. Had a bit of an issue with getting back my 20 pound deposit, as i didn't receive a receipt for it, however this was resolved promptly and courteously by email, and they sent me a cheque without any hassles.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: houghmagandie
Reviews.Content: I have found that cheap hotels in London are often unfriendly, claustrophobic dumps. The Umi was a very pleasant surprise, being spacious and luxurious for so cheap a hotel in central London. The staff were extremely friendly and efficient. The room was pleasant, large enough and very clean if slightly worn-out in places. The bed was very comfortable but my sleep was disturbed by people leaving a roisterous party in the basement bar (it was Saturday night). The location is excellent, near Bayswater tube station and a short walk from Hyde Park.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: mihaelai
Reviews.Content: location was great, next to 2 tube stations and a lot of restaurants. room was not very big but comfortable. the bathroom could have been better. the shower was not working properly, water was either too cold or too hot.

Reviews.Title: “Service not great but bed ok”
Reviews.Author: Emzly
Reviews.Content: I arrived at Umi for an extended stay so they upgraded me to a room on the top floor. I was able to get a lift to the 4th floor and then had to carry a lot of luggage on my own to the top floor up narrow stairs. I arrived in my room to a clean room with two single beds pushed together for a double bed. There was a couch and TV in the room however no where near each other. To watch TV you had to be lying down on the bed. Room service came each day and the quality of service changed each day, depending on the cleaner! Breakfast was provided and seemed adequate. When I checked out, I was sure I had paid for part of my time earlier and the manager said i hadn't. I am now $130AUD out of pocket as we could not agree on this and I have since checked all the prices out.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, average quality, but great location”
Reviews.Author: Molokov
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five nights on first arriving in London. My single room was small but clean, but had an uneven floor as it seems to span two town houses. Being nestled in Bayswater/Notting Hill it's in a great location, and prices are reasonable, but not cheap. Breakfast seemed a bit skimpy with a choice of four items only from their continental menu. Having to pay for Global Gossip internet was annoying, but for only GBP15 for a week, it wasn't too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Decent choice for a city-break”
Reviews.Author: Exiz
Reviews.Content: Booked directly through the hotel's website, and stayed for two nights. Overall, it's a good choice for a little city-break. London has a lot of better hotels on offer, but I imagine even more worse! It all comes to price, and London is nowhere near a cheap hotel-city. The reception area looks recently refurbished, and offers a nice coffeeshop/bar/lunch place, and a lounge area with some internet computers (for a charge). There's kind of a restaurant in the basement. The menu looked good, but when we entered the dining room it looked more like a conference room, and had no guests at all. (We chose to ask in the reception for some decent restaurants in the neighbourhood, and found several!) When it comes to the rest of the hotel, it's decent, but not more. Hallways and rooms seem quite old. We had a "deluxe" room, which was pretty ok. Bed was good, tea and coffee facilities, and a sink in the bedroom... The bathroom was ok, nothing more nor less. Quite hard to flush the toilet sometimes, and the shower wasn't the cleanest. One little minus was that it was only possible to open the window by about ten centimetres, and with no aircondition it got quite hot during the night. Location-wise, it all depends what you are planning to do in London. The area around the hotel offers several shops, a shopping centre, and a lot of restaurants. A five minute walk to the metro, and you'll get anywhere you want to go. However, the area is really quiet, and as such perfect to get a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “It had bunk beds!”
Reviews.Author: Foodie3197
Reviews.Content: I unfortunately had to travel with work last minute and couldn't find a hotel under Â£200 so went to late rooms and found the Umi hotel. It was located in bayswater so this was perfect for my requirements. When I arrived, very hot and tired having travelled from Scotland, I was made to wait until 2pm as this was the check in time and the rooms apparently weren't ready prior to this. When I got assigned my room I was informed that it was on the top floor (6th) and the lift only went to the 5th floor so I would have to carry my luggage up the stairs. When I eventually got to my room I was greeted with black metal framed bunk beds and a single beside it. After I managed to squeeze my way through the door and past the beds I discovered a rather unpleasant bathroom with dirt in the bath, a very smelly shower curtain and limited toilet paper. When it eventually came to having to use the bedroom I found that the curtains were hanging off the rail at both ends. The weather necesitated opening a window only to find a noisy air conditioning unit right outside. All in all not a great nights sleep, especially as the vacuum created by other guests opening and closing doors forced my room door to rattle loudly. Hope to never stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “First impression, not good, lasting impression, never again.”
Reviews.Author: allenent
Reviews.Content: A double apparently means pushing two single beds together, then trying to get a doona to fit, (it didn;t)Some lights didn't work, neither did the lock on the door.The wash basin was in the bedroom and where the tiles had been stuck on filler had been used and left unfinished. The tiles in the ensuite were also cracked and broken with discoloured grouting. The carpet was disgusting, stained with sticky patches on it, yuk!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but avoid it in hot weather”
Reviews.Author: Car035
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for a night, on an extremely hot day. In the lobby the temperature was even hotter than in the outside, as well as in the room. The room was nice and clean but very noisy. Breakfast was OK and everybody in the hotel was very kind. Excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money in the heart of London”
Reviews.Author: MissMoonUK
Reviews.Content: A group of 10 of us stayed here for a friends hen weekend. We chose this hotel as it was close to where the restaurant was, and it is also close to many Tube stations - Bayswater, Queensway and Notting Hill. The hotel is situated off the main road in a quiet leafy location. The hotel also has a restaurant bar on the groundfloor, together with a party bar in the basement. On the night we stayed they were holding a karaoke night there. As there was a large group of us staying, we had a couple of quad-rooms and a triple room. They were able to locate our rooms together at the end of the 5th floor. The rooms varied in size but all had bunk beds, toilet & shower, tea/coffee making facilities, hairdryer, flat screen tv etc. The only downside was that the windows only opended about 3 inches, We arrived on what seemed to be the hottest day of the year so it was a bit warm. However, the staff were very friendly and provided us with as many fans as they could lay their hands on. The price included a continental breakfast. You choose four items from a list, I chose a fresh fruit salad, yoghurt, toast and tea. Very nice. I would definitely stay here again as it was affordable, good quality and in easy reach of London's attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price and close to Tube”
Reviews.Author: katyeb84
Reviews.Content: I have just returned friom a two night stay at this hotel and found it to be good value and quite decent for the price. The rooms were comfortable, maybe verging on the small size but it's an old building and we were only there for two nights. There was everything we needed in the room and the beds were comfy. The only bad thing we experienced here was being woken up at 5.30am each morning by a noisy guest in the room above us. We chose this hotel for the price and location. We used it as a base to go to Wimbledon for the tennis and to see the sights. It's within a five minute walk to the Queensway and Bayswater tube stations. Staff at reception were friendly but didn't seem too clued up on some of the local knowledge. Overall it's a pleasant hotel in a good location and vlaue for money in London. I would look it up if we were to visit London again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: mikewis
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at Umi and found it a nice, no-frills hotel in a great location. My room was small, but comfortable, and looked out on a nice park across the street. The bed was comfortable, the shower hot, and the hotel quiet. I don't ask for a whole lot more. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and the internet computers were reasonably priced. When I arrived, the lobby was sweltering (it was a hot day), and my room had no air conditioning, but it was still comfortable. Less than 10 minutes' walk to the nearest Tube station (Bayswater) and some nice restaurants. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but reasonable in good location”
Reviews.Author: mlohara
Reviews.Content: I stayed 1 night at this hotel. Room was basic, but clean. Staff were friendly. Decent price for a central location. Bed wasnt the most comfortable in the world, but for a quick stay it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, mediocre accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Mll321
Reviews.Content: The location is amazing and for the price it really is a decent value but there are a few things about the Umi I had issues with. Most importantly the sleep quality. They day we got there they were doing fire alarm testing so we completely unable to sleep off our jetlag. Also, the ceilings and floors are extremely thin so you are constantly woken up by the people above you walking around. That was my biggest gripe and it was a signficant one because of how often I was woken up. Rooms really range in quality and are not necessarily determine by price. Our room was tiny whereas my parents room was twice the size and much nicer. Perhaps you can request one of the larger rooms? If you are traveling on a budget and want to stay in the best part of town this hotel is perfect but note the drawbacks.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant and clean "typical" British hotel, at reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: NorthofDC
Reviews.Content: For the price, this is a top-notch budget hotel. In other words, your price pays for the cleanliness, reliability, and staff, not for a conference room and restaurant. The hotel starts off with a very nice lobby to sit around in with a free newspaper or two, and a good breakfast each morning. The staff at the desk and at the breakfast are very pleasant to talk with. There is a pair of lifts with space for more than one person in them, which is not always commonly found. The rooms, while without paintings on the wall or fancy wallpaper or fixtures, are spotlessly clean, with comfortable beds, plenty of drawer space, a TV and reasonably spacious (for London) bathroom, though my single room was somewhat narrow. The hotel is on a street of pretty English rowhouses with a private Garden across from it (they may have a key to lend you to go in, I'm not sure). The neighborhood is 100% safe; it is 3 blocks from the Bayswater (District/Circle Lines) and 4 blocks from the Queensway (Central Line, easy to use with luggage, with an elevator + 7 steps) and Royal Oak (H&C/Circle Lines) Underground stations, and near many, many stores and restaurants, including the small Whiteley's Shopping Center. It's walking distance to Portobello Road, and walking distance to the north side of Hyde Park, where there are many local buses along Bayswater Road (near Queensway Tube) to all parts of London.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: TheTripanator
Reviews.Content: First of all, bear in mind that Umi website is a lot better than the hotel itself :-) That said... the hotel is good for it's price. I got a double room, and stayed for 4 nights with my girlfriend, and for our needs it was good. We only would sleep there and leave right after breakfast, so it was ok. We didn't have any noise problems because our room faced the back of the hotel... and the heating worked fine. Staff was nice also!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, very shabby and run down.”
Reviews.Author: NorwichCheese
Reviews.Content: One star. Very run down and tatty decor , some areas stained and torn. Some lights did not work, hair dryer completely useless. No double glazing so draughty and extremely noisy. Woken up at 6.30am by their delivery & disposal lorries which crashed around unloading for an hour with people shouting. Creaky floorboards so noise from rooms above too. A great location and nice girls on reception let down by very poor rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Will return on next visit to London”
Reviews.Author: Jane12121
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in a single room. Reception staff checked me in quickly, room was small but for Â£50, suited my purposes perfectly. Enough room for 1 person and a suitcase with a desk and wardrobe. My room over looked a lovely gated garden. Excellent location, easy walk to Bayswater or Queensway tube stations. Basic breakfast was included and free newspapers provided in the lounge area. I will return here for my next London trip when I need a centrally located, budget hotel

Reviews.Title: “Accomodated my needs”
Reviews.Author: tkr_whakatane
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay here the atmosphere was nice. My room was quite small even thou I was the only was staying in it, however it was a bed and I got a good nights sleep. I really admired the architecture externally I thought it was beautiful and I would also like to express my thanks to Jimmy the barman, Amy? the receptionist and the chef (sorry mate couldn't remember your name) got to know them a bit better at the restaurant bar on our last night they were helpful courteous and friendly during our stay there. The hotel is also in a good location not far from the station, catching the bus the local pubs or just shopping locally. What made our walk pleasant was taking in the sights of all the magnificant buildings I was in awe of them and the other positive was that my friends and I lost some weight from hitting the pavement haha. I really enjoyed my stay here and also experiencing London - it blew me away. If I ever make a trip back to London I would stay here. Thanks for the wonderful memories. Mai te Whenua o Aotearoa (NZ) nga mihi nui ki a koutou.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here ever!!”
Reviews.Author: DnG_2009
Reviews.Content: I always check Tripadvisor before i book any hotels, and i have to say sadly that this is the first time Tripadvisor reviews have let me down!! i booked this hotel expecting it to be a nice hotel... and was i wrong about that. First of all the hotel looks nothing like the pictures, when i was looking for the hotel there are such beautiful buildings in this area and was so disappointed when i realised the hotel was probably the ugliest building in the street, and more dissapointment was to follow, i think i nearly cried when i saw my room.. The bathroom sink was in the main bit of the room all hotels i have stayed at usually have their sinks in the bathroom where they belong, need i say more? After literally 5 minutes i left and booked another hotel around the corner, and then spent the next hour trying to cancel my booking with the reception staff for the remaining nights i had unfortunately booked with this hotel. Definately would not recommend this hotel, much nicer hotels are to be found in the area that are also cheaper wish i had of booked another hotel instead of this one as it completely ruined the first day of my trip to london.

Reviews.Title: “I will stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Dragon10Uk
Reviews.Content: It has everything I look for in a hotel. Clean, comfortable, close to the tube, quiet and I was able to get a good nights sleep which is the important thing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Small Room Very Little Storage Space”
Reviews.Author: CardiffWelshWonder
Reviews.Content: Hotel was really nice but room was small and very little storage space for clothes it had a nice bar restaurant on site

Reviews.Title: “It fitted my purpose”
Reviews.Author: SirHoot
Reviews.Content: Yes, this review is bit late since I stayed there back in August of 2008 but I think I got few things to say. I stayed at Umi London for 21 days back in August-September 2008. During that time, I got to know that place pretty well. First of all, this hotel did meet all my expectations, I like the location, the price was good and it could support me during my three weeks in London. The bathroom was large enough and the shower worked just fine. The room was relatively clean, sheets felt clean as well. The room was very small but acceptable as long as it was just me and no one else. For such a small room, they do have a cabinet to put away your luggage, small desk for your laptop with a wooden chair. My single bed was bit smaller then a twin size. But the mattress was firm and pillow was great. And there is a 19 inch HDTV directly opposite of the bed but high enough that my feet don't kick it. Funny that there is no ice machine, I had to go the barkeep in the basement to get a pitcher of ice each night. They do give out free newspaper each morning at the lobby. They do have internet but you have to pay, they got two small elevators as well. In case of fire, it a definite firetrap with narrow corridors but most London hotels of this kind are like that. Its about ten minute walk to Baywater Underground Station so that is nice. They do have a on-premise restaurant but the menu looks pretty pricey. The local pubs around the hotel give you a better meal with a cheaper price....and a nice pint of beer. (For most Americans, I recommended 1688! Cold and tasty.) This is definitely no frill place to stay. Sleep quality suffered because it seem to be a noisy neighborhood at time and they got parties going until the wee hours of the night. I do not recommend staying here during the heat of the summer since there is no air conditioning. I had to beg for a fan, reminding the front desk people that I am an unacclimatized tourist from Alaska who is not used to the humid heat of London! That made a different in late August - early September!

Reviews.Title: “acceptable value and will use again”
Reviews.Author: Cheshire-Flyingpig
Reviews.Content: friendly front of house staff, we had a reasonably quiet room, which as others have said was somewhat old-fashioned and outdated. It was a comfortable bed, the bathroom was just a toilet and a shower with the handbasin in the bedroom - but it all worked fine. we did not use the restaurant, and left before breakfast. The luxury of real coffee rather than instant in the room was an unexpected bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: heiranig
Reviews.Content: Good value hotel in a convenient location. The lobby and public areas are very nice but the rooms are a bit outdated. Breakfast could be better. Overall, a good address in London if budget is a concern. We were there with a group of 16 people and the hotel was perfect for the needs of the group.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: CamilaBrazil
Reviews.Content: Clean, basic and really good service. Nice breakfast (you can choose 5 items in a list) that may include capuccino, fruit, muffins and croissant. Near to 2 metro stations giving access to the main subway lines. Nice and safe neighborhood. I certainly reccomend for families and group of friends. Pay attention if you book a room in the top floor... the elevator goes until the 4th and you have to make one by stairs... Not a problem if you dont have heavy luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Loved all of it”
Reviews.Author: klassykeeler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old and full of charm. The breakfast is fabulous fresh bowls of fruit, big fluff croissants, the lattes so good. The rooms had old style hutches to hang your clothes, and hot showers with water pressure! Yes, the rooms are small (the size of camp rooms if you know what that is), and yes, you can hear people walking through the halls, and the doors squeak ,but I never had an issue with people being noisey. The staff was friendly and helpful and you had a big fluffy robe waiting for you in your room. This hotel is walking distance to everything, the tube is a 5 min walk. I went to London on vacation and the charm of the hotel, made me want to come back. The bad thing--paying for internet. I used the internet cafe at the mall.

Reviews.Title: “A great find in London!”
Reviews.Author: LondonCoco
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the UMI Hotel on two separate occasions in Dec 09. It ticked all the boxes from my research and then you just hope for the best. The hotel is situated in a very quiet, attractive garden square in Bayswater. The location is conveniently close to several supermarkets, great cafes, pubs, restaurants and the High Street - Queensway - which has everything you will need, including two tube stations. Staff at Reception were very professional, friendly, efficient and helpful - a combination that is not easy to find in London hotels. I had a lovely view from my room, overlooking the garden square. The room itself was the size you expect in London, bed very comfortable, and the room well equipped with flat screen tv, iron and ironing board, tea making facilities, desk, cupboard, hairdryer. Bathroom is quite small, but fine. Creaky floorboards can be an issue in these old buildings as I discovered on my first stay, and I was disturbed by people above me. However, my second stay this was not a problem. I am a light sleeper though, and as this is my only criticism, it is minor. The dining area near Reception has a lovely modern decor and very pleasant to be served breakfast there. It comes as you would expect in a nice cafe - on a tray with white china, lovely fresh fruit salad. The girls working in the Dining area were extremely friendly as well. A selection of complimentary daily newspapers were a real bonus and something you would not expect, given the room rates. This is a wonderful, vibrant area of London to stay, central and convenient to everything. I really enjoyed my stay at the Umi Hotel and will happily recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “PLEASANT HOTEL, EXCELLENT VALUE, GREAT LOCATION - BARGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: Lulu-la-belle
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel in November for two nights to do a bit of Christmas shopping in London. The location was fabulous - good tube links and about a five minute walk to Bayswater and Queensway tube stations. It was also amazingly close to Portabello market which was great for us. We got a really good deal for the room which ended up having four beds in (strange but we weren't bothered) it was clean with a decent bathroom, nice shower and the usual TV and amenities. Didn't deal much with staff but they seemed friendly and helpful. We got free continental breakfast which was perfect for our travel needs. There were only two tiny negatives - one being the security of the locker facility. We left our bags on our last day and anyone could have got in there. They were not very careful with the key. Also the curtain pole in our room was a bit old/bent and the curtains didn't fully meet so some light did come through. Overall, an ideal hotel/hostel and an absolute bargain - I am hoping to go back with my boyfriend in the new year. It is just ideal for a cheap weekend away for young friends/couples. Not luxury but a great stay for a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & convenient but could do better”
Reviews.Author: Rebecc13
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Umi twice; once in a single room and then a supposedly superior double (Grove) room with partner. Was hoping second time would be better than the first but unfortunately it wasn't.
